summary: This document is a series of email updates from July 28-29, 2019, regarding the psychological and medical status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. It details his complaints of numbness, sleep apnea, and his resistance to returning to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), with staff determining he is psychologically stable and planning his transfer back to SHU.

events.title: Epstein's Medical Complaints and Cell Issue
events.description: Epstein complains of numbness in his right arm and neck, and reports a running toilet in his cell kept him awake. A nurse evaluates him, and plans are made to move him if the toilet issue persists.

events.title: Psychological Evaluation and SHU Transfer Plan
events.description: A psychologist evaluates Epstein, who claims memory impairment from sleep apnea and requests to stay in the medical area. The psychologist determines no mental health issues preclude his return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and schedules his transfer for the next day.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 29, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York and was scheduled to be returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
Epstein complained of physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm and neck, and attributed potential memory issues to sleep apnea, for which he was to receive a CPAP machine.
Epstein expressed to staff that he felt the medical/hospital area was 'safe' and requested to remain there, but his request was denied as he was deemed psychologically stable.
The document shows prison staff were actively monitoring and logging Epstein's psychological state and living conditions just weeks before his death in August 2019.
